gdXHN1SYCGSOhfOXy3RJtA.text: This place was so good and so affordable! They had an all you can eat lunch special for $30. Ambiance was nice and new and it looks like it would be a fun place for dinner also! I will definitely be back again when I'm in Vegas!

q3Sqk9aWbi-a08mjs-Fcxg.text: - [x] Long over due review for this restaurant.  We visited this restaurant/bar sometimes on May.  We enjoyed everything that we tried here.  The popular Shrimps were bomb.  Both Cold and hot food items that came out were great.  The entertainment was upbeat and MC Jonas was awesome. i love everything about this place.   Music, atmosphere,  food, and drinks..... come and try them best dollar spent!!! trust me!!!

Eftkn6szPZNBmnV0O0mf1w.text: I came to Sake Rok during their grand opening but didn't have a chance to try dessert because our group basically ordered everything off the menu and we didn't save enough room in our bellies.   My go to place for honey toast is Ichiza...but now...forget that! Sake Rok blows it out of the water!   I sat at the bar this past Friday night. Our bartendar Ty was amazing. He said it was his first day, but he nailed every aspect of service! Plus, he's outgoing and silly. In fact the whole staff is just so lively and I love the fact that they interact with the guests.   Now to the honey toast. What makes it different are the honey glazed "croutons" in the honey toast. I never had anything like it. We devoured the whole thing in minutes and the best was last - the BOTTOM of the honey toast which was gooey and soaked with honey. I would come back just for this dessert!    Great atmosphere, great service, great dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey toast with honey glazed croutons. So good

GRRupjZu58CLX-pXYt3MtA.text: We thoroughly enjoyed this place.  Kind of an upscale version of Tokyo Delves in LA.  Take a moment to say hello to AMY who is in charge of the "entertainment". She is a player/coach and quite talented.  The food was fantastic - you HAVE to have the salt & pepper shrimp.  Really the sashimi was good and every appetizer that we had on BOTH of our visits.  Over one long weekend we enjoyed it enough that we went back for seconds.  Very entertaining with the "floor show" and all of the servers were SUPER friendly and took great care, while also having and sharing great fun.  Highly suggest you visit!

IZg4IXTyB1deZTekwqE26A.text: Our concierge recommended this place and we were excited to try it out. We were told the servers perform songs in between serving their tables and that sounded like a great time for dinner.   We arrived at 10:00pm and the place was pretty packed but they sat us right away. The decor was cool, the music was loud but not blaring, the clientele looked young and fun, the performing servers did a great job entertaining the crowd, etc.   The Service:  We were sitting there for about 10min and were never handed menus. Fine, it's busy, I understand. Although I saw our server walking around the restaurant, I didn't see him doing anything specific. I tried plenty of times to make eye contact/flag him down but he simply forgot we were there or something. But then a new table was seated right next to us and they were handed their menus, then their drinks, then their appetizer... all before we were even given menus. Eventually, our waiter came by and quickly dropped off menus and said he'd be right back. The problem was that he didn't come back for another 15min which meant we were there for 25min in total just waiting for someone to come by to take a beer order. My friend and I agreed that if our server didn't come by in the next few minutes then we were leaving. Sure enough, those minutes rolled around so we picked up our purses to head out and who walks on over but our server asking if we're ready with our drink orders (Seriously? drink orders? we've been ready with those for 20min). So I said to him "Listen, we were just getting up to leave. I understand that it's busy for you guys but not a single person acknowledged us or even thought to take a drink order." Our server then said "Oh, sorry guys, I'll take care of you." Since we were both starving, we gave him our small order and hoped it would come quickly.  We noticed how many tables were emptying so we were curious to check what time they closed. Found out the place closed at 10:00pm (right when we arrived) which made the whole experience worse. You'd think that if a place was closing then they'd do their best to get those tables taken care of so they can leave sooner. Instead, we were there until 11pm even though we only had a small dinner.  We looked over our check at the end to see that our server didn't "take care of us" like he implied earlier. I mean, I thought that meant at the very least a comped beer to lessen the blow that he forgot about us for 30min. Instead, I felt like he walked all over us.  The Food: Our entire dinner order was one edamame appetizer, two rolls each (so 4 total), and two large beers and it all came out to $100 before tip. The sushi itself was pretty mediocre and the garlic edamame was much spicier than we anticipated. The sad thing was that we were both hungry only a few hours after spending all that money on that tiny dinner. There are countless top quality places in Vegas and I see no point in returning to this restaurant.  tl;dr Although this place had an upbeat atmosphere, it was way overpriced and the risk of crappy service again seems too high. Not my type of sushi joint.

CNRcTU5JWmrNsHglcXEKwA.text: Had high hopes for this place, but I was totally let down. First off, got a pitcher of sangria for $50 that was well overpriced. Next ordered about $120 worth of sushi and was so small I fit it all in one frame. Their sushi orders are only one piece instead of 2. It honestly wasn't that good. Kinda bland. I will totally tell people to avoid this Disneyland style price rape.

dT9XyYemP9Uiybki7Csz6Q.text: SO interesting.  Actually, our group went into the dining experience knowing this was not the norm.  We read reviews.  That's why I'm leaving one.  We dined here before the Rolling Stones.  They sat us upstairs.  It was SO incredibly dark.  Not quaint, romantic or even swanky.  Just dark.  Hard to read the menus, no candles... only the flash lights on our phones to help.  That was the first bummer.  Our server who greeted us (Jen?) didn't reappear until the end of our dining experience.  There seemed to be a lot going on with the staff... lots of whispering, in and out of the kitchen/back room.  Just strange.  We had piles of food and nothing stood out for me.  Dinner and a little show.  Try it, you can be the judge.  I did and will probably not return.

Jm_lOc69xLax_fFKkwZOGg.text: This place is AMAZING. Good vibes are everywhere and the food is amazing. There was never a dull moment while dining here.

5ENHZSh24JM3OBjooMgrxQ.text: Ok.....service is crazy slow even @ 2:30 they had two waiters for the entire place....One of the rolls we got tasted like it was canned tuna. House salad was good though....

1-bmVjl41FyaZWjRFENttQ.text: My wife and I had an amazing experience here on Friday after watching the USA Basketball game right next door at the new T-Mobile Arena. When we arrived we decided to eat at the bar and found two seats in between a few people already sitting at the bar. You always know what kind of vibe a place has by the type of people it attracts and the people we sat next to were awesome! They were friendly, fun, and by the middle of the our dining experience we were all sharing shots of Sake! The service was on point! The food was phenomenal! And right when we were finishing up our plates - an energetic performance started to take place throughout the restaurant, right in the main dining area. Overall, Sake Rok was a great experience that we will always remember! If you're in Vegas you should definitely check this place out for lunch or dinner while you're here!

IGKjw60rg4Dzg8EXFKc87w.text: This place is awesome, beach roll you can't go past. The restaurant has a very entertaining feel about it, probably why it's called Sake Rok. The show they put on is great definitely makes you want to get up and dance a little. Food is fresh and spot on. I think I have fallen in love with this place. It's tucked away at the end of The Park NyNy might be a little difficult to find, but I'm sure you can enjoy the adventure getting there. 5 stars awesome guys.

OWNpMDKOBsHZImVYr2ncxQ.text: Great sushi and a unique, fun atmosphere.  You get a floor show, singing, dancing and performance art along with your dinner!  It's kinda of like KA, a comedy show and a rock concert rolled by a sushi master and served up fresh.  Definitely something new.  Food and drinks are very good and that's the main thing.  A great, rollicking fun time!

swdc2TOfpjQmNhHUJWxC1g.text: I held a work event at Sake Rok and my group had a blast with the Karaoke machine. The service was great!

8JEN5lzktBq3kWySY-dKKg.text: Amazing food. Great environment. Absolutely recommend it! They play old school music, they have people performing songs from the BSB, n sync, the waiters really make sure you are having the best time!

La8-HySIilnzy1JS6CmKjg.text: Came here last night with husband and friends for hub's birthday. Just looking for a sushi spot and were pleasantly surprised by the super fun atmosphere of Sake Rok. We had no idea there would be an MC and choreographed dancing by the servers. It was a blast!  The sushi wasn't spectacular, but everyone loved the NY strip and miso black cod. We also got the honey toast for dessert which was basically crack. You have to try it. One order for 5 of us was perfect. We'd definitely come back.

5OeiE3ZyCughCe5UR-kWrA.text: The decor and staff were nice but unfortunately the sushi was just not up to par. My husband and I ordered the rok and roll (?), the el chapo roll with some sort of tomatillo sauce and a sashimi platter. The rok and roll is about 5 pieces of sushi on skewers that resemble lollipops. The fish was more like a cheap chopped up filling and had a texture similar to canned tuna. There was very little flavor. The el chapo roll was tiny and again had very little flavor. The sashimi was the best dish we ordered but still tasted a bit dry, almost as if it wasn't fresh. We love sushi and never have a problem finishing what we order (which is usually more than 2 rolls and a few pieces of sashimi), but we didn't even finish the food here. Our meal came out to $200 so it was definitely a huge disappointment (especially when we were celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary). Also, kind of off topic but the restroom is very small and is shared with men's stalls on one side and women's on the other. It is strange and uncomfortable. Every person in there was complaining that they felt awkward and was not a fan of the space. Would not recommend.

46sPNf-zzQZVOOSc7Dmzug.text: Food is average. Extremely overpriced. Service was not that great either. Bartender, bathroom attendant, and show host were all very friendly and fun. As a local I would not go back.

FyZR1RM1ib5lM36vUnyCtA.text: Overpriced and sushi options are limited and small portions. Atmosphere is cool and fun so I guess you are overpaying for the entertainment. Cool idea nice spot but wish the sushi was better and bigger.

1IvkualmqgvXU2RjT7nl_g.text: Great and fun place to get sushi! I love love love the salt n pepper shrimp!!! The staff is super friendly especially Tara, she's such a great dancer!! This is my favorite place to go!

F-JEVuCB1r2qoe4G7UAqug.text: The most interactive and delicious dining experiences I have had in my life.  The fact that the otoro was just as fresh as Japan and the honey toast was the best I ever had was just the appetizer to the experience.  The boy band presentation that was inclusive of every worker in the joint was impressive. It's like they hire cirque de soil servers.  Make this a destination spot because it's a show and bomb dinner in one.

7mqyFKXCbLKsppxC1es6hA.text: The staff was awesome, the ambiance was fun just not what we were looking for. Way over priced!!!! Tuna tataki was 17$ for 5 tiny pieces and wasn't that good. We got these mushrooms that was so salty and their signature roll was gross with this weird mousse. I honestly just hated the food. The only thing I liked about this place was the staff. But for the price, I wouldn't go back.

uXam2FnpXKqD7JPxUkJ-Yg.text: This is what Vegas is all about; great food and entertainment. I'd have to say that this was one of the best dining experiences that I've had. My husband and I ordered the tofu tempura, rock shrimp, wagu beef sliders, miso cod, O toro and hamachi sashimi, king crab California roll, and of course, the honey toast. Everything is a must! The fish is so fresh, the rock shrimp was just the right amount of spicy, the miso cod was melt in your mouth, and the honey toast was so tasty and convenient to eat (they cut it up in little croutons).   Now, that was only the food. On to the staff, they are your entertainment. They are not only efficient and friendly servers, but great dancers. I was so pumped up once I left Sake Rok! What a great experience.

aeYbqy9U0wbkXZSBo6VDLQ.text: This place is great! We love the murals on the walls, the live entertainment, the music genre and the food! We enjoyed the Wagyu sliders, Rok n roll and their speciality drinks especially "asking for trouble". Definitely a must try. I don give many 5 stars by this one nailed it. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back.

AQtJjZwPKopGdqv8waErlw.text: This place was FANTASTIC!!!  I went with a group of about 20 people for my brother and sister-in law's birthdays. Right away we were greeted like we were the only group there (we weren't, restaurant was full). The service was top notch! No one's drink was ever empty, waters were topped off every 30 seconds it seemed.  We ordered from the recommendation of the manager. We received a variety of tastiness. Let me tell you, everything was incredibly delicious. The cook yourself Wagyu beef was to die for. The Godzilla platter was whimsical and mouthwatering. I love sushi and this place blew away my expectations! Cocktails were stiff and fun. We ordered the shark bowl (I believe it was called) for our entire party, Great drink!   My group had heard that the entertainment here was great, but in my opinion, that is the understatement of the year! Our first round of cocktails were a group sake bombs! Which was beautifully facilitated by our phenomenal host Jonas. This guy really had such a great energy about him, and it really enhanced our experience. I loved every aspect of the entertainment, the singing and dancing was out of this world.   The music was right in the wheelhouse of my group. Lot's of songs from our youth that was easy to sing along to. At one point we were deciding what to do after dinner, nobody wanted to leave, so we hung by the bar. The DJ turned up the music, the staff cleared some of the tables, so we had a dance and singalong party. So much so, that we closed the place down.   The owner, manager, wait staff/dancers, DJ, and everyone for that matter were so hospitable. I cannot express this enough. I can speak for my group, in saying that we were truly taken care of.  Overall I give this place an A+++ I wish I could give this establishment 10 stars, but, I suppose 5 stars will suffice. I cannot recommend this place highly enough to EVERYONE who wants to have a blast in Vegas! I go to Vegas at least once a year and from here on out I will be frequenting this fine establishment.

T3Aj3Co30CQ6uDArytogSg.text: We have tried to eat at this place 4 times now. There hostesses are rude and not customer friendly at all. We have come down for events at the T-Mobile arena and can never get into this place. An event gets over that started at 6pm and the entire crowd is hungry. This place closer there doors. It's impossible to ever get a seat.

qaUiVx0EMYKK-NpgwwA-Hw.text: This place is ABSOLUTELY AWESOME! My first time here and we were here for dinner. They had a dance show and play all the Backstreet Boys and N'sync songs for our entertainment. This place is ABSOLUTELY AWESOME!

498rHlG23flXR_2OVnyp_A.text: Had a blast here. Great food, fun atmosphere and great staff. Come on a Thursday to hear the incredibly talented DJ that also plays the violin. She was awesome. Reasonable prices to boot.

W5pda8YCatw5EdzgXgdhGw.text: Amazing, amazing, amazing experience! The atmosphere was fun and inviting, the food was out of this world, and the service was on point... Our waitress Tara and she was so fun, talented dancer, and took great care of us! If anyone is looking for an exciting restaurant with mouth watering food and great entertainment, Sake Rok is the only place to be!

nmGmtQeLGiovAwvGtREMyQ.text: Hidden Gem! Not only was the food great but their service was amazing.  Exactly what you would want going to a restaurant in Las Vegas, I didn't expect to have so much fun thinking we'd just have dinner and leave but the atmosphere was so good and Dj was playing great music we decided to just stay there until they closed:). Carlos & Rork our server were both amazing and very attentive to our needs.  He was on top of it anytime we needed something.   Definitely recommend this place if you want to have some good food and have a good time

OYCzbTkg06ObJjgzDNyCIw.text: This was my first time to Vegas and I picked this place really craving sushi that day. I went with friends for a late Sunday brunch. There were hardly any guests in the restaurant when we arrived around 2:30pm. Literally, we were one of two tables seated when we first arrived. The wait staff was extremely nice and attentive. The MC for the day was especially funny and simply exuded everything I imagined was Vegas. The dance numbers the staff performed were fun. We joined them in dancing and of course did a sake bomb with the MC! I ordered two rolls, and one was absolutely delicious while the other had a bad taste and it was clear the fish was not fresh. I eventually had to tell the waiter and return the food. The staff did everything to make it up to me, comping the bad roll and even serving us dessert on the house. I truly appreciate their efforts to make it up to me, but unfortunately I was sick with diarrhea for the next few days afterwards. I think it's the first time I've ever had food poisoning at a restaurant and despite the top notch service, it couldn't make up for the awful runs . :(

rn4vt-SoNwIbDvLvmP-HkA.text: Meets and exceeds all expectations! Most highly recommended!

pPEPV4slb4zB6UZ4l_2cIA.text: If I could rate this place more than 5 stars I absolutely would! Everything about it was perfect. The host were great, the drinks, food, servers, atmosphere and of course the entertainment. Came here for the first time tonight and loved it. We ordered the avocado roll, tiger roll, puff the magic dragon roll and the wagyu steak roll which was to die for. I would've been happy with 3 orders of just the wagyu roll it was so good. This is definitely where I will be eating for now on when I come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Middle roll is the wagyu steak roll. Soooo ridicuously good,  I want more!

afMAoQ2SKlMyYGbSp64Vag.text: Seriously you guys. This place sake rocked my socks off. We had a party of 10 show up for an early dinner and were given Rich & Mitch as our tag team servers/entertainers/eye candy. They started off with a sake shot, of course, and then went into a whirlwind of dance, song, and some phenomenal foodsk! We gave Rich our price point per person, dietary restrictions, and he took care of all of the ordering! At one point, a Flinstones type meat bone thing came to the table, accompanied by Godzilla breathing fire. The spectacle here is off the charts folks. Every 10 mins they broke into song and dance from the 90s and included our party in all of the fun. This is by far, one of the coolest group dinners we've had! Food was spot on, entertainment was legit, and for sure, ask for RICH and MITCH to enhance your dinning experience! Can't wait to come back :) :) :)

muUo-H1CG3Q-6kqpe9plwg.text: Food was excellent. Very creative and rich in flavor. Beyond that, service was phenomenal. Great place, highly recommended!

xzaLJ2bQoc58p4fcNa8Z1Q.text: This place is poppin! The funnest sushi restaurant I've ever been to. Plus their sushi is amazzzzzing. They're all so tasty and unique. I can't remember which ones we ordered because we ordered a lot but one roll had this weird bubble stuff on it for added flavor. Wasn't a fan of that but still loved the restaurant and entertainment. The menus are ridiculously huge haha.

sJNbLt8pJ7Us7Jq2azaO0Q.text: If you're wanting a show with dinner this is the place to go! Great traditional Japanese food and a fun musical ambiance to go with it ! You can get up and dance ! Will definitely come back again !

8qdkVScS2-wwaEfmdMbVlQ.text: This sushi restaurant was amazing. Right when I walked in I was impressed with the design and feel of the venue. Music was on point along with the performance throughout the evening. Great performers which were also the servers. Great service and the food was on point. Friendly staff and very welcoming! Definitely coming back again.

4R-LcwLhwnrLLaRg4tB4Sw.text: Wow!..Sake Rok was definitely a different experience.  The energy started from their outside bar and kept flowing through the night.  The servers bust out in dance routines with props and there is also a very hilarious mc that walks around.  The venue was absolutely beautiful!.  Sake Rok had an Asian theme however the place was contemporary, modern, fun, and the layout was very open.  They also have a patio upstairs with an amazing view of the park and the strip.  The food and drinks were so delicious that I wish I had more room in my tummy to eat more!  The service there was also on point. Definitely an energetic and fun place to eat. Every tourist that visits Vegas should eat at Sake Rok!

AdlAauf5dsCuCcPLfhX5Kw.text: Not a big Shushi guy but the atmosphere was very cool lots of entertainment with good drinks.

VMjNaBpARlCJFq5fFebmXA.text: Great sushi at a good price. Food came out super fast and we had fun with our server. We'd definitely come here again.

6wIZKJmLQbZ3qgWKgUqo2A.text: Hot rocks steak, sake flight, el chapo roll, spicy garlic edamame and can't forget their amazing honey toast! Great party atmosphere with constant entertainment lots of dancing.

znKcVsBLodm5zVmG9KoXJg.text: False advertisement!!! In new year, the stated it is the best place to see the fireworks and the ball drop. Nothing close to this. I complained w/ the manager and he said u can watch it in the TV, hahaha. We were just able to see the Monte Carlo building. We got a table and pay extra ticket to see OT Genesis that night. He did not sing or play any song.. this place sucks and had False propaganda. I drove to Las Vegas to have fun in New Year's Eve and we waisted our money in this place. Don't trust on this place at all.

qjvf9LFxE92eTHQ3ioiFug.text: Such an entertaining place to eat! Food was good but really it's all about the staff and lip sync battles. Went with a big group and they totally loved it!

SEY4l5Yaj7v2U3GjYIJpqQ.text: Sushi was good. Service was good. I would go back for sure.   I ordered the Brussel sprouts and they were really yummy. But very rich and heavily sauced, which is great, just not what I was expecting.   Also I didn't realize that there is an MC and performance continuously going on during dinner. We are in Vegas so I should have known. The performers were talented and the MC was lovely but if you are trying to just grab a bite to eat with out theatrics be warned. :)

FdDY2XwltE7-Rx-cqf_hnw.text: I absolutely loved this place. This Japanese restaurant is amazing and we just celebrated my mother's 80th birthday. I loved the food and the live performances from the servers...very Tokyo crazy fun. Clearly, they all had Dance Training or some sort of Triple Threat training from Juilliard. I love that they've made a lot of eighties come back music with Madonna and the host was incredibly fabulous ...dig those eyelashes! Sushi was excellent, Shrimp Tempura was delish, yummy brussel sprouts and I really loved the Tomahawk steak presented  with Godzilla. This is the best place for celebrations and wild sake bombs even though I didn't have any that night. I would love to come here again.

y9cRzx4DbnTiqfOLWLZPWA.text: Great sushi! Original and tasted amazing. My only complaint would be the service (HORRIBLE). Had to remind the waitress to do her job several times and the water tasted like pool water. NASTY!

lMGzyXm5pZ752nxcZOjvFw.text: This place was absolutely phenomenal! I called the day of to make a reservation before the concert. No problem! AND as we men know with women taking their time, I called to say we are running late and they reassured us not to worry.  When we checked in, there was a wait with guests, but we were escorted right in to our table. The hostess was pleasant and the wait staff very attentive. They provide complimentary edamame which was a pleasant surprise. We ordered three sushi rolls and a sashimi platter. The presentation and taste, not to mention the freshness of the sashimi was amazing!   The topping on the cake was the "show" that was put on as entertainment. Superb high energy with a great Pre party vibe! Hands down, I definitely would return back to Sake Rock! Plus is conveniently located across the Park Theatre and next to the T-Mobile theatre within the Monte Carlo Hotel area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great fresh Sashimi platter and rolls

MCIr4Xh4JCfRf0NHuCnbgw.text: Sushi with a show!! Cool fun place! Must try the high stakes roll, pricey but worth it. Great performers and chefs.

f0KPWwRCaCUxS5UEcTm_LA.text: I'm not sure how Sake Rok has such a high rating. I was very disappointed. The food was okay, but completely overpriced. I got a 4-piece roll, 2 pieces of nigiri, and a house Chardonnay for $50. The show was a few dancers who did a competition between N Sync and Backstreet Boys. I mean, what year is it??? The decor was kind of cool and the bathroom attendant was sweet. I would suggest going somewhere else for sushi though.

5vK3nBlL1hI35LePHuq2aQ.text: This is one of our favorite sushi restaurants to go to every time we come to Vegas. Unfortunately this visit was an exception to the usual great service we were used to in the past. Service was ridiculously slow, the restaurant hardly had anyone in it. We got the ayce. Which might have been a mistake. There is an hour limit. Our waiter took our order every 45 mins with a 3 item limit. Our plates were empty pretty much the whole time we were there, approximately 2 and a half hours! Don't think we will be going back next time. Our party of 8 were all late going back to our expo appointments. Not happy!

wDeiQViiq9a1TbeEZB2mpA.text: This place was such a pleasant surprise! The food, performance, and service was incredible! Love this place. Will be back!

CQdQeYJAMqE4u3hql1EYIg.text: Came for the lunch specials  Limited menu , but what the served was  quality. Gluten-free options are available  The chefs are knowledgeable and stated that the krab mix is Gluten-free  Tamari is served when requested  PS came at lunch when it is quite At night the photo look amazing if you're 25 year old

S1uJVSWveV0HFmCs5gvhpA.text: DON'T come for lunch!!!  This place is awesome for dinner but totally boring at lunch.  They won't do any of the "fun" things or shows during lunch hours.  I was super disappointed even after I asked.  I totally wish we had the same awesome experience we had lady time when we came for dinner. We had SO much fun last time at dinner so we brought a group of friends, new to the place for lunch and it was just a boring sushi restaurant.

6aZZa7dAcFB-1XqwP8_Jzg.text: The entertainer that was there last night was one of the most fabulous and gorgeous Queens I've ever seen. He knew the exact line between engaging the audience and keeping people feeling comfortable. He was quick witted, an excellent dancer, and basically I would have paid him to hang out with me for the night. He deserves his own 5 star review.   As for the food, it was really tasty, small portions, Vegas stupid prices (but standard). My boyfriend and I both really enjoyed what we ordered - we can't remember the name of our favorite roll but think it was called "diablo." We left full and had 3 rolls and an app.  For the drinks, we were very excited about the sake flights. This is a must! They're house sake is excellent.   Our service was also great! Our server even joined in the dance at one point and shredded up the corner of the restaurant. Also, special shout out to the second server helping us. He was from our home town of San Diego and very friendly and attentive. To the Managers reading this: every one I just mentioned deserves a bonus.

JFuvwz-YSeiE8mWairT6Jw.text: I normally don't take the time to leave reviews but in this case I will. The service was horrible at best. The drinks had no ice. The sushi was over priced. They got each portion of the order wrong and we literally had to flag down the server each and every time. The MC was painful. The MC should be the most important position in the place and he was horrific. He wasn't funny, his singing was horrible and he rubbed multiple guests the wrong way. I would strongly suggest they re-cast. Regarding the dance numbers, the expressions on the faces of the staff was like from the movie "Waiting" with Ryan Reynolds. The staff looked like they hated every minute and like they had to come out and do another Birthday song. Additionally they added a 22% service charge to the bill. I understand you add a charge for large parties but I am going to look up and see if 22% is even legal. I have been to places all over the world and for the price they are charging for sushi one has high expectations and this was truly the most frustrated I have been in years at a restaurant. I hope the owners read their reviews otherwise their investment will be short lived. They are trying to be a jack of all trades here and they have mastered none.

vVL-j6kDf-09pMoN8S8ZsQ.text: Great place, and the atmosphere is amazing. Great and friendly staff, delicious food and drinks. A Vegas must.

K8J3A3gh4F0T00fPbPAglA.text: Sake Rok is amazing! We got the tempura roll, the pork chop and honey toast. Best food I've probably ever had. The pork chop was amazing! The staff is so friendly. You get dinner and a show. If you like to have fun and want some delicious food, go! Place find in Vegas for sure!

oTEMi-GZXOkgQdKaRxqwzA.text: Did the 25$ all you can eat lunch. So much variety and great service. It's located right around the corner from New York New York. The fish was fresh, and the sushi waa amazing. Their shishito peppers are a must try at this place. Ramen came in a regular sized bowl. Definitely worth a try. If you're with a large group who can't make up their minds, this is the place to go!

GJMmfMpBCcE0zt2BJZF8Eg.text: Sake rok is the bomb!!! My gf and I came here cuz we heard about the all you can eat for 25 bucks and all you can drink sake and beer for 20 bucks! Our server Chad was very knowledgeable and had great suggestions!  THE SUSHI IS DELICIOUS!!!!We will definitely come back! Thanks for the great 1st time experience Sake Rok! You guys ROK!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ftom left to right...westside roll with a peanut curry sauce. (Middle) Peter Parker roll (right) el chapo

yOECmsbCm0UyxZh5taY4tg.text: Great food. Shrimp tempura appetizer, seaweed salad, all the rolls we had and the best scallops I've ever had. Really great food throughout. Extensive sake menu from really cheap to expensive. But overall it's just a fun place to have dinner. The wait staff doubles as entertainment and it's like eating great food at a great party. Will come back every time we're in Vegas now.

cb5HXw_DvvyarOlyRyZdhQ.text: Talk about a new sushi spot in middle of a happening place. We walked in with a group of 6... for happy hour!  On yelp it says they have happy hour m-f 5-7pm.  Hostess was clearly to busy flirting it up with another team member or manager. I asked 3 times we are here for happy hour. (Mind you, there was no one in there) She said "oh, ya we stopped it like weeks ago". That was it!! Back to talking to team member. Then we saw a sign saying all you can eat sushi, we called to ask if that was still going on.. she picked up and said oh no, just at lunch! And hung up! Talking about Vegas... horrible customer service!

19l9WXku97nzBzBmkiPi7w.text: Decent food, HORRIBLE service. There are so many great dining options in Vegas, don't waste your time on this place. The services is so awful and the staff is beyone unapologetic about it. It took nearly an hour to get our drinks and another hour to get our food, all of which came out seperately..one of the girls didn't get any of her food until after the rest of us were done eating(at least 35 minutes after the rest of the food came) and she ordered appitizers!   I've had better service at the hotel food courts.

oX_4jm36NmbNtu67uouqQQ.text: I can't believe I'm giving this a 5. It's loud, obnoxious, completely touristy - and I had a great time. Our server, whose name I don't recall, was so friendly - she really made the night for us.  We ended up here because we had to be somewhere around 11:30 and we were pushed for time to find something on the Strip at 9:30 on a Friday. We didn't realized what type of place this was until we sat down. I swallowed my pride and accepted it.  Turns out I was just being pretentious.   The food was actually pretty good and affordable. The environment was nice and the entire staff was friendly. The random entertainment was ultra cheesy but in a more ironic 'we are in on the joke' kind of way then making me feel like a suburban tourist.  We were pleasantly surprised and walked out with a smile on our face. Honestly, give it a shot, you'll have fun.

xb45NbVD2TnZgFo10wZacQ.text: Really great food & entertaining service.  Cool artwork on the walls.  Drinks were good but are expensive.  Recommend checking this place out if you are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vlPXIuL3Hj2YRf_2nk3M8w.text: The food and service was awesome. I would highly recommend the tiger and king crab California rolls.

crsQZJbNE7-jr8CfpnVw2A.text: Honestly a terrible experience from start to finish. The service is REAL bad. Waited over 45 minutes for fried rice. Our waitress acted like it was an inconvenience to bring me another drink. Please do yourself a favor and go to literally any other sushi spot on the strip.

1Uub1BX7oPpoQknoBH_ExQ.text: We were pleasantly surprised with this place. Fun atmosphere. Great service. The sushi was fantastic. Tiger roll, volcano roll, a few others, all good. Well presented. Cocktails were pricey but very good. They also had a fun MC wandering around, talking to guests. He looked a bit like Jack Sparrow. The servers put on a dance routine too. So much fun! Add this to your list of places to hit for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HsH7e1zHOG3WhKqcJnOr1w.text: Great sushi place hidden at the Park. We went there on Friday for lunch. It wasn't crowded and the sushi was fresh. The prices were average for Vegas strip. We ordered the following: Kimchee cucumber sunomono, various rolls, fries, and uni. All were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KqV7LFpgk29Goh2D3SFTNA.text: We came here because it was near our hotel and had good reviews. The service was quite slow, especially considering there were only 2 other tables seated. When we first sat down we were given dinner menus and the our waitress brought the lunch menu, which had significantly less options, but we were still able to order off the dinner menu so we were unsure what the purpose of the lunch menu was. Our waitress Jacinthe was very sweet and conversational. They were very accommodating to our needs. The prices were somewhat high for the portion sizes ($17 for crispy rice, $15 for beef satay, etc.) - but some were worth the money (tempura green beans!) The sushi rolls were pretty small. The food was pretty spicy, so keep that in mind if you don't like spicy! Overall, it was good but I wouldn't recommend going here if you don't mind going into a hotel for a restaurant that is better but inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dinner menu 2/2
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. miso sea bass
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef satay $15

WWCU3EMCWB4qL8eH3jnXzg.text: Sake Rok is the best! Not only is the sushi fresh and delicious, the entertainment is amazing. The MC is great at what he does and does not fail to make everyone dining smile! It's a bit on the pricey side, but definitely worth the money!

FKVBwwLwTJBQCwTbTc5jVA.text: We stopped in here because we wanted a light lunch and got exactly that. The place was practically empty when we came in so the perfect time to get in for lunch. We were greeted right away, the staff was very friendly and nice.   We ordered the Shishito Peppers - crispy garlic, lime, sea salt one of the most ordered items. Very taste and light every third or fourth one would be spicy to me but very delicious.   Then we just ordered two rolls because we did not want a lot so we shared the Kamikaze Roll - shrimp tempura, jalapeno, avocado, tuna, jalapeno vinaigrette, eel, sauce, lime juice, micro cilantro - this roll was amazing I thought it would be spicy but it was  not excellent combination great flavor.   The other Volcano Roll - eel, cream cheese, avocado, spicy kani & scallop, baked with spicy dynamite sauce - I thought his would have also been spicy was not, it was so delicious great mixture.   Would definitely love to try more rolls out next time where in town.

Z8Jw3bTUxHitbla2JJ4gmw.text: Yummy! Very pretty sushi bar right in the middle of the Golden Nugget casino floor. The drink and food service was very prompt. Their tempura was light and crunchy. I got a spicy tuna roll with some other stuff on it...I think it was called a Godzilla roll? That was great. Soft shell crab roll was good and the eel roll was good too.

c4ADYb7oz0PBiWw2XwwGAQ.text: Place is fun with all the music shows and the food is very good and fresh! All the workers are friendly and helpful

_7LfhVas8zhQfnTUS91gWg.text: Very fun worth the $$$  now it is crazy fucking expensive but we knew what we were getting into we're also from Texas and we wanted to be bougie in Vegas .  the appetizers tacos were bomb we got all of them . We were a group of 11 and everyone got there stuff in a timely manner. Water never went empty great service loud but you know what your getting into before you get seated . 40 something steak roll was very good as well .   Peter Parker roll and asparagus was my least favorite things but still good , I mean I ate it :p   Most importantly  Cesar was the show ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HOPHJSjkEUXUm3hohJC1Tw.text: $10 for a 16oz margarita of your choice at the outdoor bar; what a steal for Vegas prices on the Strip!    There were three flavors but I opted for the mango flavor! It was slightly on the sweet side but the drink sure had a good kick to it. It was a nice alcoholic beverage to enjoy a few hours before my flight home. There is plenty of outdoor seating around Sake Rok which is adjacent to the T-Mobile Arena.  I didn't get to dine here but I definitely will on my next Vegas trip!

VFZ6gdaGM20drJtHHyl_TQ.text: Visited in March, wonderful atmosphere! Delicious sushi!  Sake bombs were amazing!! Tip: make a reservation!

nmxWGpF4RBM0Tz8OfDpmkQ.text: Had a fabulous meal and the entertainment was outstanding.  High energy   Fun wait staff & the sushi was to die for.  Fresh,  tasty and the honey toast dessert supreme !  The salmon sashimi and amber jack melts in your mouth

wPWb6J2Qour2E_9ONRWGiQ.text: OMG...we had the BEST time at Sake Rok last night!  The atmosphere was loud and exciting.  When they say it's a "spectacle", they really mean it.  From the Sake Bomb fun to the staff shows on the bar, what a BLAST!  But it gets better, the food is AMAZING too!  We ordered several items and they were all YUMMY!  Looking forward to dining at Sake Rok again soon!

6ZXvDhBkGC2n2UtSAst5_g.text: Sake Rok is clearly struggling to survive. They hand out 2 for 1 drink coupons almost every night yet the bar and restaurant are always nearly empty.   One night we decided to stop in for a drink after a Vegas Golden Knights win and use those drink coupons. The bouncer was more interested in talking to his friends than checking IDs and kept the 5 or 6 people interested in having a drink waiting until his conversation was done.   Apparently there is no smoking in the bar (really ????) and no table service if you are outside.   After every Knights win, I light up a cigar in celebration yet I was told to put out my cigar AND leave their bar.  No this isn't a $2 cigar & I'm not going to douse it in a glass of water. No problem - I left and spent my money at one of the other bars nearby and I'll never go back, not even with BOGO drinks.

KGEfDB5TqipL41GJ-KsEPg.text: My thoughts:  1. It's pricey - everything here is between $15-40 (some even to 200!). I got the veggie roll that came out raw veggies only,although it was VERY FRESH ... it was 5 pieces. Not filling at all. Was a little disappointed on how much I paid for such little food, BUT WHEN IN VEGAS!  2.  The service was GREAT! When I came in we only waited about 5 mins.  4. There is a short show/dancing. It is fun and entertaining for a little bit. Please be advised that it gets noisy so if you're picky or on a date you mY want to go elsewhere. Its6meant to ha e ALL GOOD TIMES! It's the strip!!  5. The place is very nicely decorated. The interior has beautiful wall painting and a great atmosphere.   6. The food is okay (hit or miss). I had also purchased the agadashi tofu, that was actually tasty.  Overall, if you are visiting Vegas and want a fun place to eat and are willing to pay the price, I would recommend this place. The food isn't the best but it is different from the usual restaurant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soooooooo we went in hungry for a snack thinking it&#39;s just a regular place....NOPE...a den of awesomeness... They gave us a WHOLE SHOW!
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soooooooo we went in hungry for a snack thinking it&#39;s just a regular place....NOPE...a den of awesomeness... They gave us a WHOLE SHOW!!!

srNv7s-oEz-M7QPzXwVWCA.text: I've walked by this spot so many times and I wish I had ventured in sooner. It's a party with good food and drink.  I started with a Sake Sangria that had a nice flavor and wasn't too sweet. The drink packed some punch and left me happy. For starters we shared Crispy Rice and Edamame (add garlic butter). The Crispy Rice was delicious and had the heat I craved. This was unexpectedly small compared to portions most restaurants serve for this starter. The Edamame was great and had a little kick to it.   Our main rolls were the El Chapo roll and Shrimp Tempura roll. Both were delicious, but small portions so I'd definitely order more next time. We wrapped up with Honey Toast which was very good. The server cut this open for us which made it easy to eat.   The atmosphere is very lively and closer to a party than a restaurant. It made for a fun dining experience. The staff worked together wonderfully to make sure we had everything we needed. It was excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Toast
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Rice Appetizer
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura Roll &amp; El Chapo Roll

lp_yiuXpREurIeh_l33RGA.text: So I'm in the area for the week and, per usual, I'm always in search of a great sushi place. Well you can completely end your search if you are anywhere near Sake Rok. I dined for lunch and was surprised to find that they have an all you can eat option, which includes starters, regular AND signature rolls for $35--SCORE!! The best part about it was the quality of their sushi. They serve extremely fresh, flavorful and very presentable sushi, which is a big win in my book. I ordered the Tiger Roll, Girl on the Beach, and the Spicy Samurai. None of them disappointed! In fact, I alone, ate all but four pieces. I also received wonderful service, which added to my experience. The servers were super nice, friendly, and kept my glass full at all times. I definitely plan to return any and every time I come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top to bottom: Tiger Roll, Spicy Samurai Roll, and Girl on the Beach Roll

H21oRqoHJAr-fKED4TlZ2Q.text: Great sushi, lots of fun and unique experience. It's also in a perfect location if you then want to walk to the TMobile arena.

56aviFZgmmMiqVkgt4ZWDQ.text: This is my third review of Sake Rok. Ill be brief and to the point: drinks, food and entertainment? ON POINT!!!! My server Tara? OUTSTANDING. She was warm, genuine and overall kick ass. Thank you Sake Rok. You guys are 1 of a kind and thank you Tara for taking care of my group with that smile...........

7K4WTPKVBKxnoxF_xVoCYA.text: I have visited here previously about a month ago. I had a great time with a friend enjoyed a bottle of wine and a few sushi rolls and the edamame. I am not a sushi newbie and frequent excellent restaurants in la where I live. This time today was the worst experience I have had in a long time. Not to mention the fact the both times I've been here it's been extremely slow so you think service would be better when there is a bunch of people standing around. The only one who had manners was the man who greeted us so nicely and consistently gave us water throughout our meal. The little girl who was "waitressing" our table was lacking so many skills.  The downfall for me was when I tried the $40 sashimi plate. I was gagging on the texture of the fish because I don't believe it was cut properly. The presentation was beautiful but lacked taste and everything I put in my mouth was chewy. When I finally got the waitress over to let her know after summoning other colleagues of hers because she was no where to be found she said we ate the majority of the fish which is a lie. Out of 12 pieces we ate a total of 4. So after her telling us she didn't need our tip and started arguing with me about charging us for the fish we never ate I went and spoke with one of the chefs. In the end they took off the fish but it's sad that this wasn't taken care of previously and she tried to interagency as I was speaking with the manager. On so many levels of hospitality this was wrong. Event though the said they would make it up to me next time I will not be back.

2eY8IR3h3hTyaOjGsGTZdw.text: Been coming to Sake Rok now since they opened and each time have been amazing! My friends and I had such a great time and we were there for a celebration. Our server Tara was so nice, fun and really attentive! She is a definite asset to their staff! :)  Not only is this place entertaining, the food is absolutely delicious! My favorite dishes are the Pan Seared Scallops & the baked crab hand rolls made with baked snow crab and this spicy aioli sauce, they are made to perfection! I will definitely be back!

6AboVOOSLAm5l6y1-r3UsQ.text: We came in yesterday afternoon. We got there at around noon and the place wasn't too busy. Once we sat down we were greeted by our server. She was very sweet and navigated us through the entire menu. She also started off by asking us if we have any allergies and I thought that was refreshing because my friend has a slight shellfish allergy that I didn't know about. We started off with the garlic and chili edamame, best one I've had so far btw! Our server Jenny recommended some sushi rolls and I had the el chapo roll and my friend had the spicy samurai roll. We had a lovely dining experience here and we can't wait to come back!

yHfeju5hmPleU6oIknJJcA.text: WOWWWW what an amazing vibe comfortable yet invigorating fun. Never been somewhere that I felt I got more than I expected in every category. 6-7th time I've been and it gets better every time. Just wait till you see Vince perform or any of the other big talent unleash their inner entertainer to create the best atmosphere you've been to in vegas. Food, smiles, staff, location, foood, and SMILES

gv3xBPGvkCfhkjYHNQygRA.text: I'm not much of a seafood eater, but I recently went to Sake Rok with friends and loved it! The food was amazing and the entertainment was fantastic! Can't wait to go again!

RWdtMgIndMwWrp8cpE-ocA.text: I don't usually write reviews but this is one exception that I don't mind making. If it wasn't for the lasting impression that the employees, atmosphere, food, and well... everything, has left on me, I probably wouldn't bother writing a review.   My friend had his bachelor's party in Las Vegas over the weekend and we stumbled upon a little hidden gem of a sushi restaurant right next to a huge glowing statue of a dancing woman. Entering the restaurant, I immediately felt the vibe and energy of the venue. People were cheering, laughing and having a great time. Then the performers came on. They did all sorts of covers of 90s hits from backstreet boys and N sync. It was amazing and nostalgic, magnificent.   The food was delicious served by a pair of the friendliest servers I've met all weekend. James and Jen were exceptionally receptive and helpful, not to mention really funny, haha! They taught us how to take sake Bombs, the Sake Rok way. "When I say Sake Rok, you say Sake Bomb!" Then we proceeded to pound the table until the shot of sake fell off of the chopsticks and into our beer. Awesome! The event hyped the night to come.  Would I come again? absolutely. Ill bring an army of hungry fun loving friends as well.  Thanks to all the great talent and service guys!!!!

KAZ8el-uIVvTEe93uCfR8g.text: The most amazing food and an excellent service. They did all they could to acomodate our needs! I absolutely recommend it!

pHKTE78MW4OqXqwWC3lj-w.text: This place is something else. Great concept: food, sake, and live entertainment! Our server Mike helped guide us through the menu and made some awesome suggestions. We had a seared tuna, crispy shrimp, and a steak that melted in our mouths. The sushi came out on a platter with a smoke breathing Godzilla!! Lol.. They put my girlfriends name on the big screen for her birthday which really completed a great night. We will definitely be back!!

a8iQXfHayrzJMMDJCl0ffQ.text: Awesome place!! Servers/dancers , great theme .. Our server Tara recommended us a few drinks, which has the name of what I was looking for that day , it was called "Asking For Trouble", it has jalapeno tequila in it!! And the Rok Shrimp Tempura is a delightful, spicy dish! Highly recommend this place if you want to have a Vegas entertainment experience while you eat :)

Oe6hcQ2GGDKMRNC9xyLMxQ.text: THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC!!!!  The sushi was FANTASTIC, the entertainment DIVINE, and the service was UNPARALLELED!!  Tara, Nick, and Cesar made this experience phenomenal.  I took my mother out for dinner and we had no idea what a great time we were in for.  Cesar put on a show for the entire room as well as the servers who clearly put time and effort into learning their routines to keep the atmosphere lively!  Tara and Nick took such good care of us, gave great recommendations, were extremely attentive, and made sure that our experience was nothing short of splendid.  If you like sushi and fun, THIS is the place to go.  Live DJ keeping the vibes very upbeat, performances by the staff every half hour or so, and the chefs have clearly mastered their trade.  Highly recommend the El Chapo roll for an out of this world taste like I've never had elsewhere.  The combination of jalapeno puree and the slice of lemon will make your tastebuds jump for joy! This was the total package that you wouldn't expect from a sushi bar, but something taken right off the strip in Vegas in terms of satisfaction and entertainment!  Thank you to Tara, Nick, and Cesar for showing us a wonderful time and we look forward to coming back again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left to right: Tiger Roll, El Chapo, 49th State, Shrimp tempura

_9xY9FNRbJOjgGo86UX7AA.text: My friends and I were there for a birthday celebration and I had such a great time. Our server Tara was very nice and really fun! In the middle of our dinner the entire wait staff broke out into a dance. She literally pulled me out of my chair dragged me up to the little stage to dance with them! Not only was this place entertaining, the food is absolutely delicious! My favorite dish was the Pan Seared Scallops made to perfection. I would definitely be back!

hLPJdxxT-AZW0hAXn834YQ.text: Sake Rok was amazing!! Every single dish we tried was more delicious than the last. The atmosphere and music were awesome! They had us dancing in our chairs all night! Our server Mike Kolb was amazing, make sure to ask for him!! This place is a must go to!!

gwO8k-sC_QcPbJWRHUTAFg.text: Stopped in here on a Wednesday evening. Got right in. The sushi is okay. I have had better. Pretty fun atmosphere though. They are very entertaining. They have a host on a microphone who goes around to the different tables and the entire staff will randomly break out in dance. Entertaining, but not my first choice for sushi.

SgaykuDYOJ3Kw9fRtWJHXw.text: This review is long over due. My boyfriend and I were out visiting a few weeks ago we just had to check this place out based on the reviews. Atmosphere was great, food was superb but what really made the night special was our server jenny. Thank you Jen for your recommendations. We'll be coming back for sure. Wish I could give 6 stars!

3eeTyWMGfIaJNpDV80aF9w.text: This was the best restaurant I have been to,awsome sushi,great atmosphere and dancing staff:-)

ClNk5mWJ8ICZ5LtSJWRYhg.text: THe food was okay, but what really stood out as way subpar was the service. They just couldn't get it together, mistake after mistake. They seemed to be super busy doing bad lip sync. The redemining quality was the honey toast, it was good. But the service was awful, we kept having to ask for our dishes, they brought the wrong stuff, it was a shitshow of mistakes.

YxFnkobnDvVUrFl5c9jgOQ.text: At Sake Rok you can expect the unexpected.  Servers break out into dance battles and choreography, the alcohol flows and the food is outstanding.  We went there with a large group and had the server do a shared fixed menu, which was awesome because everyone got to try a little of everything.  Sake Rok is located in the Park in front of T-Mobile Arena, between the Monte Carlo and NYNY casinos. Parking is easy at Monte Carlo main valet or NYNY self parking for direct access.  The stand-alone outside location is much better than trudging through one of the bustling casinos.  My favorite dishes are the Rock Shrimp Tempura and the El Chapo roll.  Head chef came from Sushi Samba and it shows.  Highly recommend, 5 stars all the way.

6ft-X4YUESt0zE-5xUMWtA.text: We came to see what this place was all about tonight......... Being Vegas locals, we have seen a lot and aren't surprised by much. With that said, we were very entertained by the "Dancing Staff". Dancers were great and the two Singing Hosts (MC's) made you feel like part of the cast. I have to have to give it to the Geisha Female ( MC) singer, I believe her name is Lily.... she made her rounds and joined every group, but to top it off..... this girl can SING ( better than anyone on the Strip)!!!! Thank you for making our "Monthly Night Out"!!!!!!

brhYw2xAbIK1Rya_Nrv73A.text: Who doesn't love sushi & entertainment?!? Definitely a fun entertaining environment. Tara McClintick is the most amazing, talented, sexiest dancer/server in Vegas. I would go just to see Tara!!!

9hIHLRXLyJXVIWMvaIho3g.text: Great place to grab some dinner and drinks off the strip. There was a live entertainment show for a bit. If you're looking for a quiet place then this is not it. Ended up coming back in the day with kids, and then enjoyed it too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

21FKMINFj_Wz4BKE0_1Taw.text: I wish I had pictures of this place because you would see yummy food and so many smiles! We've been 3 times (we're Vegas locals) and each time have had such a ball. The sushi is honestly just average, (there are better places if that's exclusively what you're looking for) but this place is all about the atmosphere. Its fun & def worth checking out. They play great, loud music. The waitstaff is attentive and creative. They all dance and lip sync and the emcee of the evening is always a riot. He does sake bombs with guests and pokes fun at them a bit-- or flatters them. The music is all sing-along and the DJ pumps some good jams. It's an over-the-top great Vegas spot to take guests. They have yummy cocktails and the apps/meals are good- so if you have a non-sushi lover, there's plenty to chose from. It's a bit pricey- but it's the strip. Go for the fun.

6BGMN_XQSK7fRtql3mB8kA.text: We just flew back into town and were hungry. This place was located next to the hotel so we thought we would give it a try. I'm glad we did.  The only reason it didn't get five stars is we both walk away hungry. The portions are small and expensive.  However, the food was outstanding so it earned the stars for that. Oh and the price is worth the entertainment! You not only eat yummy food but the music and ambiance is great. Also your servers dance and sing and are very entertaining.   Will we go back? We probably would for the entertainment but we will come less hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool wall art
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dancing on the bar.

RrCHsFYWos0PULGc0NRz1g.text: This place is really fun. The sushi is pretty good, not the best. But the entertainment there is awesome.

bRq2SRhC8WU9785_bngJ3A.text: We came here for lunch on a Saturday at 11am right when they opened.  Very nice atmosphere and decor, and pretty quick service. The all you can eat options are a bit deceiving and confusing, but not horrible. They food was good but not great, it was within walking distance to our hotel though.  With so many other options in Vegas, not sure we will make it back anytime soon.

0OYOIYKd6p7O8tos76LgRw.text: We went there this afternoon for lunch and the service was terrible!!! When we couldn't find our waitress anywhere and we were waiting to order additional items, we looked around and saw she was upstairs taking her break... Usually your server tells the table that so they can put in additional orders and introduce the person taking over...right?? Well my husband had to walk up the sushi bar and place his order after waiting forever. Our bill also wasn't correct at the end of our meal  The place was just a hot mess. Ps. If you order the hot sake, keep on mind a large is $18. Our waitress said it's so expensive because its "hot". Wtf....

HHT6FkcnIajhF6wDgHa9Jw.text: I tried sushi rok for the first time and I'm pretty impressed. It's different from any other sushi restaurant because the staff interacts with the audience. If you're looking for a show to go with your sushi, this is the place for you. They also have plenty of sushi options to choose from and all the rolls we got were delicious

sV_nYHfCFOQfLt9CWw10fA.text: Wow,   This place is an experience!! Dancing and singing food servers, bar tenders, and sushi chefs.    The entertainment is fun and the food is superb.   Tara our server was very accommodating and was very knowledgeable about the menu.  She was also a great dancer!!  It was my wife's birthday and her name was put up or lights on the wall.   This is a FUN place and Tara made my wife's birthday special!!

u2LPzw34klkh8VP45QfYCw.text: One of the best sushi restaurants I've ever been to. Not only was the food amazing, the hospitality was superb,  not to mention the entertainment which was awesome too! Everything was great. Will definitely return and I recommend if you're looking for a fun sushi joint.

804307Bn-lWuBN7COjb6dg.text: Good sushi , interesting entertainment, loud but fun , not a place for a quiet dinner. A little high in price , I guess you are paying for the entertainment. At first I hated it because it was so loud, but once I got settled it was fun.

qcs2DGsWlA1klDtS4OxVig.text: The all you can eat sushi option to 4:00 pm on weekdays is pretty legit. They have some great rolls and starters, including the gyoza and edamame of course. It's also right by the T-Mobile stadium so there is plenty going on in the area. One heads up, they don't offer the all you can eat during an event at the stadium, so plan accordingly.

0ADn5CQyqypI1abAgyKanQ.text: To be honest, I just can't get past these crazy prices. Ok, the location is ok, but that still doesn't  justify these crazy prices for just OK food. I tried the sliders, chicken, and sushi and nothing made me want more. Honestly I only ate the food because I paid for it. How about this I would never go there again even if I had a 50% off coupon.   Tip - After you walk in a see the over the top prices on the largest menu in the world, it is ok to just walk out and go somewhere else. Or and another tip, just ignore the crazy guy massaging the other guy at the bar. I guess one of the employees was sore and another guy was rubbing ice on him. This isn't a joke. I should have taken a picture of this.

nb2us4XAnl6uh1pDT345aw.text: Awesome dining experience!! The MC, Cesar, was a BLAST! The waitstaff/dancers were so friendly and entertaining and the food was delish. Will definitely recommend to others!

VPyr2HkBaDJp1E6zSZZtlQ.text: I was very disappointed with this restaurant. The decor is on point, music and energy also on point but I think that it was a tourist trap. First, the sushi rolls are so small and the order that they bring you the main course, the appetizers and drinks is way rude. You will feel rush to order so be prepared to know what you want and when you want it. And last, too expensive for those annoying things.

HQScyK2rOZpHhODG51STrQ.text: The mc was rude to us, I guess because we brought kids, but we didn't really know what kind of a place this was. The sushi was way overpriced and mediocre. The waitress poured water into our sprite which seemed like something that apparently happens often here.

ypEXJUhPr7HoWDW3-gNreQ.text: Sunday Brunch!  The place looks awesome.  The food was spectacular!  Loved, Loved,  Loved the Lobster Benedict! Not to mention how much I loved the Poke Stack, Omurice, Skirt Steak and Eggs, Roasted Chicken, and ROK French Toast. Oh and you can't leave without a Sake Bomb and you can't do brunch without a bottomless Mimosa! Now that I think of it....I loved it ALL.  I need to come here at night because I can imagine this place ROKS (See what I did).  The service was great, the entertainment was fun for a Sunday.  The MC, think his name was Simon, was fun and engaging.

j3uxaWnDvPOLI5abY9AYSg.text: Josh and kevin make excellent food. They have O toro here (tuna belly) which is super rare and especially delicious.  Hand rolls were lovely, nigori sake on the menu and excellent mochi for dessert. We stopped in several places before choosing here and are so glad we did. What a perfect first restaurant to try on our vacay. 5 stars!

4ybCvw1TEFBr5rFk1imuGQ.text: Good food, great drinks and fun show. The sushi can get pricey fast, but it was a nice change from other strip restaurants. The drinks were fantastic; of course they had the sake but the other drinks were quite yummy too. The show that goes along with your dinner was hilarious, certainly a good time. The servers were all very attentive as well

mRoIlynHug5XrEgxm_8n4A.text: Sake Rok is the place to go if you're looking for a fun, energetic atmosphere! The show is entertaining and engaging, the food is amazing and mouthwatering and the best part was our awesome servers Sariah Eesha and Nick who made the experience even more memorable! 10/10!!

DUmcXNimuPeMAKsbG0pX0Q.text: Sake Rok is definitely the place to come to if you want AMAZING sushi in Vegas and they have so much more!!! All of the servers especially Eesha Nick, and Sariah are impeccable. The show they provide is outstanding and the main reason why I always come back... Love this place can truly say it's the BEST!!!!

03JIPmZP1lWaxUzoCuJaoQ.text: We made reservations on Open Table after reading the reviews on Yelp.  This is a new trendy sushi spot in New York New York area.  It was our 20th wedding anniversary dinner before our show.  Upon calling Sake Rok, I specifically  inquired about the All You Can Eat menu.  We wanted to do that as the rolls that they had were really expensive and not worth it.  However if you do the AYCE menu it would be worth it.  She insisted that it was the best way to go and confirmed our dinner reservations. We arrived and were seated back by the elevator.  At the 6:45 time we arrived, the place was DEAD - like really no one was there and the girls waiting to seat us were so busy with their own conversation and playing with their hair and phones that we felt ignored.  The DJ (??) at the bar was pretty loud and obnoxious dressed in drag.  Once seated it took literally 7 minutes to be greeted by our server.  In the 7 minutes we waited, we were confused as the menu didn't have the AYCE option.  We were disappointed in the sushi roll selection.  It was pretty limited compared to most places and the ones they did offer were outrageously expensive.  Seriously, who pays $17 for a basic California roll?  As we sat there waiting, we decided that this was not the place for us.  FINALLY our server arrived and asked if we wanted water?  Really, we sat here for 7 minutes with no service and you are asking if we want water?  A drink in Vegas would have been appreciated.  Then what sealed the deal, I asked about the AYCE menu as it wasn't to be found.  She said, "oh that's only at lunch."  WHAT???  I specifically spoke with the hostess 3 days ago asking about the menu, details and reservations -she never told me it was lunch only.  THAT'S IT -we left, walked out, didn't eat and then had to find a place to grab dinner before our show.  Such a disappointment.  I should have listened to the Waldorf when they suggested Yellowtail at the Bellagio over this place!  Don't waste your money or time!

o5Y5Rs9zB7nbhd2Jir3aiQ.text: When we first walked in, we were greeted with loud, booming music and synchronized dancing employees. We were quickly seated in the corner of the restaurant with a great view of the dancers and the rest of the customers. I was relieved to be placed away from the dancing employees. They tried to get as many people to dance with them and were super extroverted.  The noise level of this place was similar to going to a night club. If you needed to talk to someone, you pretty much had to speak up really loudly or else the loud noise would drown out your voice.   The menu was a little hard to read. The disco lights kept changing colors. The area we were sitting at would go dark and then become bright after 5 seconds. I had to wait for the room to get bright before making my food selection.   I finally selected the Salmon Avocado Roll ($10) and Tempura Roll ($15). Each roll contained 8 pieces.   The Salmon Avocado Roll had tons of salmon. Some of the salmon pieces I received were 0.5" x 0.5" x 0.5". This place was also not cheap on the avocado pieces. I could actually taste avocado unlike the other sushi restaurants I have been to. The Tempura Roll was great as well! The rice tasted as if it was deep fried. I did not see tempura flakes. It tasted very warm and fresh. The spicy mayo was a little spicier than what I remember.   This place was a little expensive, but the food was great!

2YD5_4S560TPsUbtJbRTvw.text: Went here for my best friend's 30th birthday. We made very early reservations for 5 as we had tickets to Zumanity at 7. Staff was very nice, we had a lot of fun, the food was great, however it's a little bit pricey but it's worth it. Don't skip the sake bomb!

6SJSdQIkaR7Rq93SE0F-4Q.text: We stopped by at this restaurant for a quick,  late lunch. We were seated immediately--there was only one other table seated at the time.   The restaurant is insanely cool. I love the industrial decor and the art work. The wait staff were very nice and really helpful. So right off the bat I was really happy with having chosen this place for lunch.   I started with a cocktail--the Dragonfly. Freakin' delicious! I highly recommend it. Then I had the Tiger roll...also insanely good. I would have ordered more food, but I was still quite full-ish from breakfast.   An incredibly awsome spot!

oWz4H34aIQ5W3wx9Jkqbyw.text: This place was so much fun.  Go during typical dinner hour and enjoy the show.  Food was great and the staff were awesome.  The entertainer was so great!

Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gLIXYLzxeZ2cGbHLe6xu_g.text: Holyyyyyyy molyyy! If there's a place on the strip I'd recommend to try, it'd definitely be Sake Rok. Tourists and locals alike--Sake Rok is a restaurant you MUST visit at least once.   Sake Rok is fun. It's vibrant. It's lively. It's delicious. It's just overall a great place to be. If I wanted to recommend a place to be for an occasion, Sake Rok would be perfect.   The staff break out in song and dance every now and then. There's an MC (shoutout to Jonnis--I love you and you're amazing) who interacts with the guests and really makes the place alive. If you're lucky, you may even get pulled up to dance :)  Food - 5/5 I can't tell you how much I enjoyed the food here. There's definitely a unique touch to it, such as the edamame and the peppers you're given in the beginning. The sashimi tastes fresh and melts in my mouth. The sushi rolls were all amazing! I had one dish that involved mushrooms & steak and it was ah-may-zingggg. Overall, all loved the food!  Drinks - 5/5 Okay the cocktails are typical strip price so don't be scared. It tastes amazing. The staff really gave me great recommendations, drink after drink!  Staff - 5/5 I really can't complain. Everyone was helpful and friendly while also being energetic and fun :)  I highly recommend giving Sake Rok a visit! The food, the drinks, the staff, it's all amazing! Great energy, great time. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bsxvokYoJ6x4MA3X52EcdQ.text: Wow!! What an unexpected freakin' AWESOME experience!! We wanted sushi and got more than what we asked for. Sushi was great and delicious!! The entertainment made the night!! If you are wanting an experience to remember and one with eating sushi!! GO!  Thanks for an awesome time!! SAKE BOMB!!!!

J4LR0a3LE8Si3PrLjTJmEw.text: What a fun place to dine! There was a DJ & MC and the ambiance was SO fun. I took my two young sons, whom weren't  big sushi fans (until now). The quality & taste of the fish overcame many reservations they had about going RAW!!

EcOodT7EG6F4NaK-ssxSIQ.text: The sushi was very good.  There was supposed to be entertainment but we did not see any. I am guessing we came too early maybe? The food was good and the service was great. Quite expensive for not having a show or anything included.

nbCmQbtZeG8eScqhx29g0A.text: Just tried the "high steaks" roll which includes a5 waqyu beef ( premium beef), Alaskain king crab, foie gras butter, truffle and all I can is this by far on the spectrum of the creamiest sushi experience. I high recommend you give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Sake Rok - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I35vUcWB6lwH_gQ37bSPnA.text: Okay. I don't even know where to start. First, if I could give our experience a 10, I would. Our server Amy was amazing. We explained to her that a few of us had food allergies. I'm gluten free and my friend is allergic to shellfish. She throughly explained to us what we can order and what we shouldn't. She even asked the sushi chef about a couple rolls just to make sure they were indeed gluten free. I ordered the tiger roll, spicy tuna roll, and salmon nigiri. All were very good.  Now on to the entertainment! Sake Rok is dinner and a show. Every 30 mins the servers do a little skit. The creative director was awesome and made our experience memorable! Will definitely be back. Thanks for making our friend Micha's birthday a great experience!

6PikbqDRGqFLd4wK41aMFQ.text: Terrible. I ordered the 12 piece Omakase for $44 but got the $55 Omakase.  The service was average at best. The brought out the sushi and didn't even tell me what was on the plate.  As you can see from the photo, the tuna and salmon?   Quality of the sushi was average.  I went on a Sunday night and they were not busy. They had a 90s night music and MC.   If you're looking for something unique or exceptional sushi, this is not the place.
